content:
Diagnosis
	1. Intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma with widespread metastatic disease

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Gemcitabine/Cisplatin Jan-Mar 2024 (3 cycles)
	2. Durvalumab/Gemcitabine/Cisplatin Mar-May 2024 (4 cycles)

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with clinical deterioration

	Current issues
	1. Progressive liver dysfunction
	2. Malignant ascites requiring weekly drainage
	3. Severe fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	This 62-year-old gentleman has unfortunately shown disease progression despite two lines of systemic therapy. Recent CT on 15/5/24 shows increasing liver metastases with new peritoneal deposits and malignant ascites. His performance status has declined to ECOG 3, spending >50% of time in bed. Liver function shows progressive deterioration with bilirubin 85, ALT 156, ALP 445. He requires weekly paracentesis for symptomatic ascites.

After detailed discussion with [redacted name] and family, we have agreed to discontinue systemic anti-cancer therapy and focus on symptom control. He understands the poor prognosis but maintains good understanding and engagement in care decisions.

	Further investigations
	Weekly monitoring of liver function

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg daily
	Furosemide 40mg daily
	Oxycodone MR 30mg BD

	Follow up
	Referred to palliative care team
Weekly ascites drainage clinic

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor liver function weekly
Prescribe breakthrough analgesia as needed
DS1500 completed today
